segments.en: And today we're bringing you the next part of our suspense series, The New Guy in Town.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来悬疑系列的下一部分，《镇上的新家伙》。

segments.en: So we know that Armada wasn't really a vampire, that he was just acting.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道Armada并不是真正的吸血鬼，他只是在演戏。

segments.en: And the women aren't quite what they seem in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 而这些女性在对话中并不完全如表面所示。

segments.en: In the last one, something happened and she transformed into some sort of, I don't know, creature, right?
segments.cn: 在上一个对话中，发生了一些事情，她变成了一种，我不知道，生物，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so now let's see what happens.
segments.cn: 对，所以现在让我们看看会发生什么。

segments.en: So we're not going to preview any vocabulary this time.
segments.cn: 这次我们不打算预览任何词汇。

segments.en: Let's just listen to the dialogue and see what happens.
segments.cn: 让我们听听对话，看看会发生什么。

segments.en: What the heck is going on?
I'm just glad we made it out.
segments.cn: 我只是很高兴我们活下来了。

segments.en: What seems to be the problem?
Officer, officer, there is like a witch creature back there.
segments.cn: 警官，警官，后面有一个女巫生物。

segments.en: We tied her up but she broke me and she was about to have us for dinner.
segments.cn: 我们把她绑起来了，但她挣脱了，差点要吃掉我们。
好吧，冷静下来，冷静下来。

segments.en: Let me see your eyes, please.
Have you been drinking tonight, son?
We suspected her of being a kidnapper or a rapist, but turns out she's an alien or something.
segments.cn: 我们怀疑她是绑架者或强奸犯，但结果她是外星人或其他什么。
好吧，冷静下来，冷静下来。

segments.en: Let me see your eyes, please.
Are you gonna help us out or not?
Okay, let's go have a look, shall we?
Be careful, she might be hiding.
I don't think things are turning out very well for our housewives and Armand.
segments.cn: 我觉得我们的家庭主妇和Armand的情况并不好。

segments.en: Apparently the police officer is not gonna make it to the next episode.
segments.cn: 显然警官不会出现在下一集。

segments.en: Alright, so we saw some really great vocabulary and even though it's kind of a scary story, there is a lot of things we can learn, so why don't we take a look at it now in Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看到了一些很棒的词汇，尽管这是一个有点可怕的故事，但我们可以学到很多东西，所以为什么不现在在语言收获中看看呢？

segments.en: Well, we're gonna look at five words and phrases here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将看五个单词和短语。

segments.en: And the first one, they described this woman as a kind of creature.
segments.cn: 第一个，他们把这个女人描述为一种生物。

segments.en: Alright, so what exactly is a creature?
Well, a creature can be any animal.
Yeah, like from a mouse to a bird to an insect or a bug.
segments.cn: 是的，从老鼠到鸟再到昆虫或虫子。

segments.en: So I can say a bird is a flying creature.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说鸟是一种飞行生物。

segments.en: But sometimes we also use it to mean an unknown and scary animal.
segments.cn: 但有时我们也用它来指代一种未知且可怕的动物。

segments.en: So there's a creature under my bed.
segments.cn: 所以我床下有一个生物。

segments.en: Yes, or some type of creature was attacking me.
segments.cn: 是的，或者某种生物在攻击我。

segments.en: Okay, so a creature can be any sort of living thing.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以生物可以是任何一种生物。

segments.en: Alright, what about our next one?
Well, the creature broke free from some ropes.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个生物挣脱了绳子。

segments.en: When you break free, you escape from something that stops you moving.
segments.cn: 当你挣脱时，你逃离了阻止你移动的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so you have the ability to move again.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你有能力再次移动。

segments.en: You break free from maybe ropes.
Okay, so I can say, oh, I finally broke free from that awful relationship.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我可以说，哦，我终于挣脱了那段糟糕的关系。

segments.en: Now, that's quite interesting the way we can use this in different ways.
So why don't we take a look at some examples now.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在来看看一些例子吧。

segments.en: We tied up the dog, but he is trying to break free.
segments.cn: 我们把狗绑起来了，但它正在试图挣脱。

segments.en: I'm glad that I broke free from that horrible relationship.
segments.cn: 我很高兴我挣脱了那段可怕的关系。

segments.en: I want to break free from all my daily responsibilities.
segments.cn: 我想挣脱我所有的日常责任。

segments.en: Okay, so break free, it's clear now.
segments.cn: 好吧，挣脱，现在很清楚了。

segments.en: So why don't we move on to our next word.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不继续下一个单词呢。

segments.en: They thought that maybe this creature was a kidnapper.
segments.cn: 他们认为这个生物可能是绑架者。

segments.en: So a kidnapper is a criminal.
segments.cn: 所以绑架者是一个罪犯。

segments.en: All right, and what exactly does a kidnapper do?
segments.cn: 好吧，绑架者到底做什么？

segments.en: A kidnapper takes someone to a place and keeps them there against their will.
segments.cn: 一个绑架者把某人带到一个地方，并强迫他们留在那里。

segments.en: All right, so I guess that makes sense, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我想这很有道理，对吧？

segments.en: Because the word has kid in it.
But it can be also you can kidnap an adult.
So this word can actually be used in three different ways.
segments.cn: 所以这个词实际上可以用三种不同的方式。

segments.en: So we saw a kidnapper, right?
segments.cn: 我们看到一个绑架者，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and the verb to kidnap.
Or a noun describing an action.
segments.cn: 或者是描述一个动作的名词。

segments.en: Yeah, a kidnapping took place today.
segments.cn: 是的，今天发生了一起绑架。

segments.en: Okay, so very interesting word and of course it's illegal to be a kidnapper.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个词很有趣，当然，成为绑架者是违法的。

segments.en: So our next word is also very serious and it's also a crime, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们的下一个词也很严重，也是犯罪，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so that is a person that... who forces someone to have sex.
segments.cn: 好吧，那是一个... 强迫某人发生性行为的人。

segments.en: Okay, so again against their will.
segments.cn: 好吧，再次是违背他们的意愿。

segments.en: Okay, and the verb would be... to rape.
Okay, so on the lighter side we heard the police officer say something in a very strange way.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在轻松的一面，我们听到警察以一种非常奇怪的方式说话。

segments.en: He said, let me see your eyes please.
segments.cn: 他说，请让我看看你的眼睛。

segments.en: Okay, so this is an interesting phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一句有趣的短语。

segments.en: It's a sound made from pushing two words together.
segments.cn: 这是将两个词合并在一起发出的声音。

segments.en: Why don't we hear a few more examples of this and see if we can figure out what are the two words.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听几个这样的例子，看看我们能否找出这两个词是什么。

segments.en: Let me have a look inside the car.
Let me go out tonight, dad, please.
Let me think about it and I will give you an answer tomorrow.
segments.cn: 让我考虑一下，我明天会给你答案。

segments.en: So basically lemme is... let me.
segments.cn: 所以基本上“lemme”就是... 让我。

segments.en: Yeah, let me have that pen.
Now we do this also with other words, right?
segments.cn: 现在我们也可以用其他词这样做，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so an interesting thing, it's not proper English, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，有趣的是，这不是标准英语，对吧？

segments.en: No, you wouldn't really write it this way.
Or find it in the dictionary.
But it's really common when people speak.
And actually it's more likely that you'll say lemme gimme than let me give me.
segments.cn: 实际上，你更可能说“lemme gimme”而不是“let me give me”。

segments.en: So I think now it's time for us to listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 所以我想现在是时候让我们第二次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and look at some other phrases that we saw in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来看看我们在对话中看到的一些其他短语。

segments.en: What the heck is going on?
I'm just glad we made it out.
segments.cn: 我只是很高兴我们逃出来了。

segments.en: What seems to be the problem?
Officer, there is like a witch creature back there.
segments.cn: 警官，那里有一个女巫生物。

segments.en: We tied her up, but she broke free.
segments.cn: 我们把她绑起来了，但她挣脱了。

segments.en: And she was about to have us for dinner.
Let me see your eyes, please.
Have you been drinking tonight, son?
We suspected her of being a kidnapper or rapist, but it turns out she's an alien or something.
segments.cn: 我们怀疑她是绑架者或强奸犯，但结果她是外星人或其他什么。

segments.en: Let me see your eyes, please.
Are you gonna help us or not?
Okay, let's go have a look.
We're gonna look at two phrases now in Fluency Builder that you might hear when you're talking about a crime.
segments.cn: 现在我们要在流利构建器中看两个短语，你可能在谈论犯罪时会听到。

segments.en: So the first phrase that we're gonna look at is, what the heck is going on?
segments.cn: 第一个短语是，究竟发生了什么？

segments.en: What the heck is going on?
What the heck is going on?
Okay, so this is just asking what's happening, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这只是问发生了什么，对吧？

segments.en: But it's a very strong way of saying what's happening.
segments.cn: 但这是一个非常强烈的说法。

segments.en: Now, why do they say what the heck?
segments.cn: 现在，他们为什么说究竟是什么？

segments.en: Well, heck is sort of a polite way of saying hell.
segments.cn: 嗯，究竟是说地狱的礼貌说法。

segments.en: Okay, so instead of saying what the hell is going on?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以不说发生了什么地狱？

segments.en: What the heck is going on?
Because especially in American English, we don't like to talk about religious words.
segments.cn: 因为特别是在美式英语中，我们不喜欢谈论宗教词汇。

segments.en: So like hell and God and Jesus, these things are impolite in American English.
segments.cn: 所以像地狱、上帝和耶稣，这些在美式英语中是不礼貌的。

segments.en: You don't want to offend anyone.
So that's why we would have other words like, oh my gosh.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么我们会有其他词，比如，哦我的天。

segments.en: Okay, so that is an interesting thing.
And of course, it is a little bit of a sensitive topic among some people.
segments.cn: 当然，这在某些人中是一个敏感话题。

segments.en: So that's why it's better to just use these synonyms.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么最好使用这些同义词。

segments.en: And what about our next phrase?
segments.cn: 那我们的下一个短语呢？

segments.en: So they suspected her of being a kidnapper.
segments.cn: 所以他们怀疑她是绑架者。

segments.en: So suspected her of being a kidnapper.
So I suspect she is an alien.
segments.cn: 所以我怀疑她是外星人。

segments.en: I suspect him of being a liar.

segments.cn: 认为某事是真的，但不确定100%。

segments.en: To think something that is true, but not be 100% sure.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我认为她是绑架者。

segments.en: So you can say, I think she is a kidnapper.
Oh, I suspect her of being a kidnapper.
Why don't we hear a few more examples?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听几个例子呢？

segments.en: The police suspected him of being a bank robber.
segments.cn: 警方怀疑他是银行抢劫犯。

segments.en: We suspect our dog is responsible for this mess.
segments.cn: 我们怀疑我们的狗对这个混乱负责。

segments.en: The neighborhood suspected that our neighbor was selling drugs.
segments.cn: 邻里怀疑我们的邻居在卖毒品。

segments.en: So we've seen a lot of vocab.
segments.cn: 所以我们看到了很多词汇。

segments.en: So I think it's time for us to listen to our dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 所以我认为是时候最后一次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
What the heck is going on?
I'm just glad we made it out.
segments.cn: 我只是很高兴我们活着出来了。

segments.en: What seems to be the problem?
Officer, officer, there is like a witch creature back there.
segments.cn: 警官，警官，那里有个女巫生物。

segments.en: We tied her up, but she broke free and she was about to have us for dinner.
segments.cn: 我们把她绑起来了，但她挣脱了，差点要吃掉我们。

segments.en: Let me see your eyes, please.
Have you been drinking tonight, son?
We suspected her being a kidnapper or a rapist, but turns out she's an alien or something.
segments.cn: 我们怀疑她是绑架者或强奸犯，但结果她是外星人或其他什么。

segments.en: Let me see your eyes, please.
Seriously, are you going to help us out or not?
segments.cn: 说真的，你要帮我们还是不帮？

segments.en: OK, let's go have a look, shall we?
Be careful, she might be hiding.
OK, well, Marco, we're coming near the end of this series, aren't we?
segments.cn: 好吧，马尔科，我们快到这个系列的尾声了，不是吗？

segments.en: It's a short series, but what do you think happens or how do you think the series ends?
segments.cn: 这是一个短系列，但你认为会发生什么，或者你认为这个系列会如何结束？

segments.en: So we want to hear from you.
segments.cn: 所以我们想听听你的意见。

segments.en: What do you think is going to happen?
Come to our website at EnglishPod.com where you can leave us your questions, your comments, or even maybe your ideas, not only for this lesson, but for any lesson that you would like to hear.
segments.cn: 请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，您可以在那儿留下您的问题、评论，甚至是您对这节课或任何您想听的课的想法。

segments.en: Well, guys, we're happy that you downloaded this lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们很高兴你们下载了这节课。

segments.en: And remember to check out our website.
But until next time, thanks for listening and goodbye.
segments.cn: 但在下次之前，感谢您的收听，再见。
